page.title: 11A DAY AT HOLLY TREE FARM
page.content: At 10.00 we arrived at Holly Tree Farm. We asked the farmer lots of questions and he was very patient with us. He told us that the farm is slowly being taken away by the housing estate. If the Council damage any of the crops in their developments then they have to pay for them. He rents his fields for 363 days a year so the Council can't take the fields away except for the two days!! After we had finished asking questions we were shown the farm animals(horses, goats and dogs). Then the farmer took us to his father's nearby farm where we saw cattle, cows, hens and ducks. Before we went back to school we just had time to look at the milking parlour. We all enjoyed our day very much.
